resources.string: Hello! Welcome! And thank you for using this app. This little app is a project made by me and a friend during our year abroad in Japan in 2022/23. During that time, as a student, I went travelling.... a lot and one thing you notice whilst travelling is that at many train stations, museums and tourist attractions, there are stamps available. Not postage stamps! Print stamps! And what better way to record your travels than with free stamps and or stamp rallies. And that is where this app comes in. This app records your stamp progress and helps you find said stamps. Honestly, I have been trying to find an app that does exactly that, but even on the Japanese play store, it seems that such app doesn\'t exist. So why not make it yourself. Am I right? \nAnyways, if you need help or there\'s any bugs or features you\'d like to suggest, let me know on one of these channels below.

1. The stamps in question are different to the shrine/temple seals that are available at temples and shrines. If you do plan to collect them, again you can use the app to make a record of them, if you so wish. 
However, there are no current or future plans to implement them into the app. 
2. Due to the nature of the app and the source of the data, you must search in Japanese Kanji. 
3. Due to the nature of the app and the source of the data, information will mostly if not be fully displayed in Japanese. Therefore it is recommended that if you do not know Japanese, have a translator handy. 
4. Updates may come incredibly slow, so bare with us. 
5. This app is by no means a full compulsory list of stamps, meaning that not all stamps available will be on the app.
How to search on the app

Due to the nature of the app, you must search in Kanji. 
This can be done by pressing the search bar and typing the location, alternatively you can search via filtering. 
 
 To use filtering to search: 
1. In the explore tab, press the 3 lines on the search bar. 
2. Choose your filter or filters. You can have more than one filter. 
3. Once filters are chosen, press Filter Search. 
If you want to filter search again, make sure to press Clear Filters before filtering your search again.

You may have noticed the difficulty star system that is in the app. \nWell, this is due to various factors, such as availability of the stamp, location of the stamp (e.g. on the way up to Mt Fuji), whether there are train station staff are available at specific hours, (I experienced this one the hard way) or other requirements. \nHonestly, not 100% sure here, since this was due to the difficulty scaling from our source website, but that\'s what makes finding them fun. o(≧▽≦)o
How to create a custom stamp or stamp set

Let's first define a stamp and a stamp set. 
A stamp set is the the group of stamps in a singular location. A stamp is a singular stamp. 
You can have any number of stamps in a stamp set, but not vice versa. 
1. Long hold the location where the stamp location is located. 
2. Fill in the details of the stamp location. 
3. Press Add Stamp to add an individual stamp, to finish press Add Stamp again. 
4. To add more stamps in a stamp set, repeat step 3. 
5. Once all information is completed 
Key things to note with custom stamps: 
 - Currently there is no way to filter for custom stamps using prefecture or difficulty. 
 - The only filters that works with custom stamps is distance and entry fee.

To help you maximise our stamp gains, here are a few general locations where stamps are located: 
1. Tourist information centres 
2. Museums 
3. Castles 
4. Airports 
5. Train stations 
6. Roadside stations 
7. Observation towers 
8. Certain events, like Comiket 100 
9. Basically any tourist attraction. 
 
Here are some useful websites that you can use as well: 
They can be google translated for those not confident in their Japanese. 
https://stamp.funakiya.com 
https://100castlestamps.com 
 
If you are still unable to find the stamp, a simple sumimasen eki (station) / kannkou (tourist) sutanpu wa doko desu ka? does the trick.
And with that, go and stamp 'em all! ＼(≧▽≦)／ 
 [insert red pointing at you to go catch 'em all]
